text: CREDIT AGREEMENT dated as of January 15, 2024 among SOLARSPAN PARTNERS LLC as Borrower, the Lenders party hereto, and DENHAM CAPITAL as Administrative Agent. SECTION 1 - DEFINITIONS. "EBITDA" means for any period consolidated net income plus interest expense, taxes, depreciation and amortization. "Debt" means all indebtedness for borrowed money. SECTION 2 - CREDIT FACILITY. The Lenders agree to provide a $50,000,000 senior secured term loan. SECTION 3 - FINANCIAL COVENANTS. (a) Leverage Ratio: Borrower shall maintain a ratio of Debt to EBITDA not to exceed 5.0x as of the last day of each fiscal quarter. (b) Fixed Charge Coverage: Borrower shall maintain Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio of at least 1.25x. (c) Minimum Liquidity: Borrower shall maintain unrestricted cash and equivalents of at least $10,000,000. SECTION 4 - REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. Borrower shall deliver to Administrative Agent monthly financial statements within 30 days of month end and quarterly compliance certificates within 45 days of quarter end. Annual audited financials due within 90 days of fiscal year end. SECTION 5 - COLLATERAL. The Obligations shall be secured by first priority liens on all assets of Borrower including project assets, contracts, and accounts. SECTION 6 - EVENTS OF DEFAULT. Events of Default include failure to pay principal or interest, breach of covenants, material adverse effect, and cross-default to other indebtedness exceeding $5,000,000.

FIRST AMENDMENT TO CREDIT AGREEMENT dated as of October 1, 2024 among SOLARSPAN PARTNERS LLC as Borrower, the Lenders party hereto, and DENHAM CAPITAL as Administrative Agent. RECITALS: Borrower has requested certain amendments to the Credit Agreement dated January 15, 2024. Lenders have agreed to such amendments on the terms set forth herein. AMENDMENTS: Section 3(a) is hereby amended to change the Leverage Ratio covenant test frequency from quarterly to monthly, with Debt to EBITDA not to exceed 5.0x as of the last day of each month. Section 4 is amended to require monthly compliance certificates within 20 days of month end (changed from 45 days for quarterly). Section 3(c) Minimum Liquidity threshold is increased from $10,000,000 to $12,000,000. Section 4 is amended to add requirement for weekly AR/AP aging reports. New Section 3(d) is added: Minimum Project DSCR of 1.15x measured quarterly. PRICING: As consideration for this amendment, applicable margin is increased by 25 basis points to S+575. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES: Borrower represents that no Default or Event of Default exists as of the date hereof. All other terms and conditions of the Credit Agreement remain in full force and effect.

CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION MEMORANDUM - GRIDFLEX ENERGY ACQUISITION OPPORTUNITY. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: GridFlex Energy is a leading independent power producer focused on grid flexibility solutions including battery storage and peaking generation assets. The Company operates 500MW of generating capacity across ERCOT and PJM markets. INVESTMENT HIGHLIGHTS: (1) Essential grid infrastructure with long-term contracted revenues providing 70% cash flow visibility. (2) Strategic positioning in high-growth markets experiencing renewable integration and grid reliability challenges. (3) Experienced management team with 20+ years operating power assets. (4) Strong financial performance with $35M EBITDA and debt/EBITDA of 3.2x. BUSINESS OVERVIEW: GridFlex owns and operates 300MW battery storage (4-hour duration) and 200MW natural gas peaking facilities. Assets are strategically located in constraint zones with strong spark spreads and capacity payments. 5-year average capacity factors of 25% for peakers and 1.2 cycles/day for storage. MARKET OPPORTUNITY: Power market fundamentals strong with growing renewable penetration driving ancillary services demand. ERCOT capacity scarcity pricing events averaged 12 days annually. PJM capacity prices increased 40% in latest auction. FINANCIAL SUMMARY: 2024 Revenue $85M, EBITDA $35M (41% margin), Debt $110M, Equity Value $140M. Last twelve months Free Cash Flow of $22M after debt service. TRANSACTION STRUCTURE: Equity investment of $50M for 35% ownership alongside management rollover of 15% and debt refinancing of existing $110M term loan.
